Operation 'policytroubleshooter.iam.troubleshoot' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The operation lacks a summary entirely and the description, while accurate, omits critical details for AI agent decision-making. Enhanced version specifies: (1) the exact input structure (AccessTuple with principal, resource, permission), (2) the response format and decision types (GRANTED/DENIED), (3) the diagnostic nature of binding explanations, and (4) clarifies this is read-only analysis with no side effects. This enables AI agents to understand when to invoke this operation and what to expect from the response.

data.current_description: Checks whether a principal has a specific permission for a specific resource, and explains why the principal does or does not have that permission.
data.description_suggestion: Analyzes IAM policies to determine whether a principal (user, service account, or group) has a specific permission on a resource and provides detailed explanations of the access decision. Accepts an AccessTuple containing the principal, resource, and permission to check. Returns a TroubleshootIamPolicyResponse with binding explanations, access decision (GRANTED or DENIED), and diagnostic information about which policies and bindings affected the result. This operation performs read-only analysis and does not modify any policies or permissions.
